alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 25 at 7:03PM EDT until June 25 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN HANCOCK COUNTY... At 702 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Van Buren, or 7 miles north of Findlay, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Findlay, Fostoria, North Baltimore, Arcadia, Van Buren, Bloomdale and Bairdstown. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for northwestern Ohio. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
